results.title: NBC Valentine greeting
results.brief_description: Drawn directly on black and white 35mm film stock, this early Norman McLaren film is a play on the theme of hearts. Two hearts cavort, change shape, shoot arrows at one another, give birth and finally become one heart bearing the message ‘Will you be our Valentine?’. This short clip greeted NBC Television viewers on Valentine’s Day, 1940.

results.title: NBC
results.brief_description:
Please be advised: This film features flashing lights that may potentially trigger seizures for people with photosensitive epilepsy.

The Frank Eidlitz Collection contains the 16mm and 35mm film work of graphic designer and visual artist Frank Eidlitz (1923–1997), predominantly made during a Winston Churchill Fellowship at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT), Cambridge in 1966. The collection contains Eidlitz’s experiments with light, movement and technology in film.

This short film features Frank Eidlitz’s early experiments with light, colour and motion. Commissioned by the television network National Broadcasting Company (NBC) to reinterpret the station’s classic peacock logo, Eidlitz produced a series of film experiments with kaleidoscopic spinning lights.

To create these visuals, Eidlitz covered a series of disks with pieces of reflective paper and fluorescent colours, which he then placed on an apparatus that spun the disks at a high speed. The motion could be varied and stopped at any time, allowing the artist to create varying designs and images.

Opening with a close-up of a woman’s face covered in reflected lights, the majority of the film is comprised of flashing lights and spinning colours. The NBC peacock symbol appears intermittently throughout the film, at the forefront of the image.

results.title: NBA Showtime: NBA on NBC for Game Boy Color
results.material_description: Cartridge videogame. Cartridge, manual, registration card, consumer information booklet and Nintendo Power advert in cardboard box
results.brief_description:
A 2D adaptation of the 3D console game, this port maintains the fast, action-packed and unrealistic two on two style of basketball from the original. The switch to 2D actually harkens back to the series’ roots, which began in the same style before switching to 3D.

The game includes all 29 teams of the 1999-2000 NBA season, with over 100 featured players. Modes include exhibition games, full season, playoffs and a practice mode.

results.title: NBA Jam Tournament Edition for Game Boy
results.creator_credit: Acclaim Entertainment Ltd and Torus Games
results.material_description: Cartridge videogame. Cartridge in plastic cartridge case
results.brief_description: An update from NBA Jam, the Tournament Edition continues to employ the fast and action-packed and unrealistic form of basketball from the original. Up to four players players can take part in the two versus two matches, with each controlling a single person for their team. The computer fills in for for missing players. The Tournament Edition increases each team’s roster to three, and allows for substitutions between quarters. Shoving players now results in injuries, which lower a player’s stats, which subbing recovers. New additions the Edition include randomized zones on the court that reward extra points for making a basket while standing within them, powerups that help with scoring or hurt the other team and Juice Mode, which increases the speed of the game.
results.title_for_label: NBA Jam Tournament Edition for Game Boy

Shoving players now results in injuries, which lower a player’s stats, which subbing recovers. New additions the Edition include randomized zones on the court that reward extra points for making a basket while standing within them, powerups that help with scoring or hurt the other team and Juice Mode, which increases the speed of the game.

results.title: NBA Jam 99 for Game Boy Color
results.creator_credit: Acclaim Entertainment Ltd and Torus Games
results.material_description: Cartridge videogame. Cartridge, manual, registration card, consumer information booklet and Nintendo Power advert in cardboard box
results.brief_description: NBA Jam 99 employs the two-on-two arcade gameplay of that series is known for. This game is similar in gameplay and graphics to NBA Jam Tournament Edition, which was created earlier by the same developer, but with updated colour graphics and animations, more modes, and updated teams and players. Game modes include playing a single game, a full season, playoffs and a practice mode. All 29 NBA teams of the 1998-99 season are included, with five star players per team, each with their unique skills. In fitting with the game’s arcade style, abilities include being able to control both players on a team, power-ups, hot spots where bonus points are scored, juice mode for accelerated gameplay and more.
results.description: NBA Jam 99 employs the two-on-two arcade gameplay of that series is known for. This game is similar in gameplay and graphics to NBA Jam Tournament Edition, which was created earlier by the same developer, but with updated colour graphics and animations, more modes, and updated teams and players. Game modes include playing a single game, a full season, playoffs and a practice mode. All 29 NBA teams of the 1998-99 season are included, with five star players per team, each with their unique skills. In fitting with the game’s arcade style, abilities include being able to control both players on a team, power-ups, hot spots where bonus points are scored, juice mode for accelerated gameplay and more.
description_for_label: NBA Jam 99 employs the two-on-two arcade gameplay of that series is known for. This game is similar in gameplay and graphics to NBA Jam Tournament Edition, which was created earlier by the same developer, but with updated colour graphics and animations, more modes, and updated teams and players. Game modes include playing a single game, a full season, playoffs and a practice mode. All 29 NBA teams of the 1998-99 season are included, with five star players per team, each with their unique skills. In fitting with the game’s arcade style, abilities include being able to control both players on a team, power-ups, hot spots where bonus points are scored, juice mode for accelerated gameplay and more.

results.title: Nazi Germany: years of triumph
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “The Rise and fall of the Third Reich”.
Second episode of a three part series. Covers the period prior to the Reichstag fire in 1932 to the Dunkirk evacuation. Based on the book by William L. Shirer. Narrated by Richard Basehart. Suitable for secondary level.
results.description:
Episode number 2 of Series “The Rise and fall of the Third Reich”.
Second episode of a three part series. Covers the period prior to the Reichstag fire in 1932 to the Dunkirk evacuation. Based on the book by William L. Shirer. Narrated by Richard Basehart. Suitable for secondary level.
description_for_label:
Episode number 2 of Series “The Rise and fall of the Third Reich”.
Second episode of a three part series. Covers the period prior to the Reichstag fire in 1932 to the Dunkirk evacuation. Based on the book by William L. Shirer. Narrated by Richard Basehart. Suitable for secondary level.

group.title: The Rise and fall of the Third Reich

group_siblings.title: Gotterdammerung: fall of the Third Reich
group_siblings.creator_credit: Jack Kaufman, Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer and Wolper Productions

group_siblings.title: The Rise of Hitler
group_siblings.creator_credit: Films Incorporated, Jack Kaufman and Wolper Productions

results.title: Nazi Germany
results.brief_description: Presents extracts from newsreels seen by the British public in the 1930’s covering aspects of Nazi Germany. Shows Hitler’s appointment as Chancellor; his election campaigning and subsequent victory; the Nazi regime’s appeal to Austria; Germany’s rearmament; a Nazi rally; the re-militarisation of the Rheinland; the arrival of Jewish refugees in England; and the Nazi march in Prague.
results.description: Presents extracts from newsreels seen by the British public in the 1930’s covering aspects of Nazi Germany. Shows Hitler’s appointment as Chancellor; his election campaigning and subsequent victory; the Nazi regime’s appeal to Austria; Germany’s rearmament; a Nazi rally; the re-militarisation of the Rheinland; the arrival of Jewish refugees in England; and the Nazi march in Prague.
description_for_label: Presents extracts from newsreels seen by the British public in the 1930’s covering aspects of Nazi Germany. Shows Hitler’s appointment as Chancellor; his election campaigning and subsequent victory; the Nazi regime’s appeal to Austria; Germany’s rearmament; a Nazi rally; the re-militarisation of the Rheinland; the arrival of Jewish refugees in England; and the Nazi march in Prague.

results.title: Navy material handling: the fork truck
results.brief_description: Compares old and new methods of handling materials, demonstrating the use of two and four-wheel hand trucks. Shows the advantages and versatility of various trucks including the mechanised fork truck.

results.title: Navy in focus. Special edition No. 9. Island patrol
results.creator_credit: Australia. Navy Office. Directorate of Public Relations
results.brief_description: On patrol in the waters of Papua New Guinea, HMAS Aitape is one of the five patrol boats keeping watch on the thousands of miles of coastline. Shows the boat visiting out-of-the-way villages and the headquarters of the Papua New Guinea Division of the RAN, as well as the training of sailors from Papua New Guinea and the RAN.

results.title: Navy in focus. Island sailors
results.creator_credit: Australia. Navy Office. Directorate of Public Relations
results.brief_description: Shows training of native recruits for the Papua New Guinea Division, Royal Australian Navy, at Manus Island and in Australia. Training includes strategy on land, at sea, survival at sea, as well as technical instruction in engineering, navigation, radio operating and other specialised fields. Shows an intensive campaign of recruitment throughout the island, and the enthusiastic response of the Papua New Guineans.
